Show HN: Functional data types for TypeScript development
text:
I would love some feedback on this library I'm making. I've dabbled in FP for years and my journey has led me to create this library.

As a front end dev, I see a lot of complexity in code bases as data is wrangled into various shapes before finally getting turned into ui elements. An API request gives you back a dumb object, and if you don't turn that object into something "smart", inevitably it becomes complicated, hence the ubiquity of state managers like Redux and it's ilk.

I've had great success in functionally modeling my data using the TS/JS class keyword, and I'm trying to make some of that power accessible to anyone who wants to use it. I believe that if you model your state properly, you can avoid the need for external state management completely in most cases.

I started with a Bool monad because it was simple, and a Maybe monad because most of the `if` statements I see in code are for checking whether data is present or not. I think the next item will be a queue or deque. Thanks for checking it out.

title: Ask HN: Does it make sense to create pitch deck for an early stage company?
text:
More background: We're starting a company, and while we have a first pilot customer and some revenue already, we're very early. We've been doing it as a side project, and will go full-time in January.

We need to raise some money, because it's not a pure software business. It's a e-commerce logistics company, and we need expect to invest around $1m before we can reach the needed economies of scale for profitability.

Our strategy is to raise money from angel investors. My question is: Do angels who invest so early in companies expect a pitch deck? If yes, what would I put in the pitch deck? It's not like we have a ton of insights and numbers to show at this point.

Should we focus on the problem, on the market opportunity and on the team?

I'd love to hear from founders who have successfully raised from angels, and of course from angels who have invested in companies.

Show HN: Tree-merge.com. Merge e-commerce categories with a web UI
text:
Hello,

I built this web UI to merge multiple tree based e-commerce categories into one "super tree".

You can export the super tree as JSON, and import it into another system such as a search engine.

Users can then select a single category and view items from all of the semantically equal categories.

The app is here: https://app.tree-merge.com/

You can download the sample categories and use them to demo the UI.

Tell HN: The only thing certain in life
text:
Death, taxes and being banned from social media by artificially (un)intelligent censorship mistakes

Today I read about an astrologer a lady from Sydney Australia with a popular online astrology blog and business who was basically banned from Facebook because she posted an illustration of the planet Saturn which was picked up by their AI pornography detection algorithms as being pornographic even though it contained no humans or animals or anything inside it was just an illustration of saturn. But it was flesh colored and that was enough to trigger the bureaucratic kafka-esque nightmare for her to reapply for her Facebook account. In the end she decided it was too much hassle and didn't bother

I always thought it was only controversial opinion pundits going against the dominant narrative who would get picked up on spurious trumped-up misinformation charges to be deplatformed by these ridiculous AI monstrosities but it seems like it can happen to anyone. So I'm proposing this new theory the third pillar of certainties in life behind death and taxes is accidental suppression by our not so benevolent AI overlords wielded pretty f*** irresponsibly by massive companies

Who nevertheless pretend they're all about the positive vibes y'all and helping humanity stay open connected organized and accessible

But it seems to me really we're like the f*** Lab rats that they can ab test their AI-fuelled money printing machines on

So f** that stay aware be informed and I hope you can somehow avoid the deplatforming yourselves
